item.title: Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone Includes First-Person Combat, Customization & More
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/chernobylite-2-exclusion-zone-includes-first-person-combat-customization-more/

The Farm 51 has been working on Chernobylite 2 for over three years, and today, one of the most significant milestones for the team has been achieved. The Kickstarter campaign for this game has reached more than 200% of the initial funding goal. The team exceeded its campaign target with six stretch goals, which has allowed the team to secure additional expansion of the project beyond the original plans that were set in place. This includes extra locations to explore for both single-player and co-op missions, as well as a customizable interface. The Farm 51 has created an infographic that goes into detail about their Kickstarter, as well as the team's dedication to creating this new game.

The developers have announced that the Kickstarter campaign will continue to be live thanks to the option of Late Pledges, where those who pledge can still support the team and get some of the rewards that are available.

One of the most exciting parts of the team's news is that Early Access is just around the corner for Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone. The Farm 51 has confirmed today that Early Access on Steam will begin on March 6, where approximately one-third of the final game's content will be available for players to explore, as well as provide the team with valuable feedback while they continue their efforts in the development process.

For those just hearing about this game, Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone is a post-apocalyptic action RPG that combines free exploration in a realistic open world with challenging combat, base management, non-linear storytelling, and more.

Character creation is a huge main feature of this game, as you get to develop your hero exactly how you want them. Whether it's skillful combat, being a fantastic conversationalist, or someone who can charm their way out of sticky situations, it's entirely up to you.

You can also choose how you handle the combat in Chernobylite 2. Whether you decide to utilize the complex melee combat system or use a variety of firearms to take out your enemies, the choice is completely up to you.

Base building will also be a huge part of this game, where you can develop your base, create valuable items, and upgrade your weapons. Here, you can assign your people to tasks where they will continue to take care of your equipment and supplies while you are away.

You can play the game your way, whether it's playing solo, or experiencing and engaging in online co-op missions, the choice is yours.

Chernobylite 2: Exclusion Zone will be in Early Access on PC on March 6, with it soon to follow on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S. For more information, check out Alessio's Q&A with the team.

item.title: Dark Messiah of Might and Magic RTX Remix Mod Gets New Trailer; Online Co-Op Mod Now Available
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/dark-messiah-of-might-and-magic-rtx-remix-mod-gets-new-trailer-online-co-op-mod-now-available/

The cult classic Dark Messiah of Might and Magic is receiving a lot of attention in the modding community thanks to wiltOS Technologies, which is hard at work on three mods (plus a bonus one) to rejuvenate the 2006 game originally developed by Arkane and published by Ubisoft.

Firstly, there's the Restoration mod, which brings back some cut content with the help of Ubisoft. The modders were provided with access to assets from Elements, the Xbox 360 version of the game. Thanks to this, the bonus missions and alternate levels that were featured in that version of the game can now be played on PC. Players can also experience The Caves, a cut level, and use cut weapons such as the Sword of Misery or the Necromancer's Staff.

WiltOS Technologies even introduced quality-of-life features such as the Bonus Maps system, which allows level loading without console commands, and a redesigned new game menu with chapter and class selection taken from the Elements. With the Bonus Maps menu, the madders also added a Challenge mode that uses the map add system.

Then there's the online co-op mod, which has just launched as a public test build downloadable via GitHub. This is still an early build, though, as evidenced by the fact that three major features are missing: the new player models, the refined revive mechanics, and the cutscenes.

Lastly, there's the Dark Messiah of Might and Magic graphics overhaul mod powered by NVIDIA RTX Remix. This mod just got a new trailer, which you can find embedded below.

The team of asset makers for the RTX Remix mod has expanded from two to three, but these high-quality assets take a long time to complete. Because of that, wiltOS Technologies plans to first release a version with the original textures and the RTX Remix enhanced lighting and then slowly introduce the improved textures as they are ready.

The bonus mod mentioned earlier in the article is a proof-of-concept for random map generation based on certain rules. Called 'The Trials of Kha-Baleth', it's meant to be an unofficial continuation to the story that uses DungeonGen technology derived from Alien Swarm's TileGen technology. In addition, players have the option to simply start a randomized level or create their own campaign. You can follow the progress of this work on the dedicated page.

Are you excited that Dark Messiah of Might and Magic is getting all this attention after nearly twenty years from its release?
